page.title: 18OUNDLE MARINA
page.content: The original gravel pit supplied materials for runways on wartime airfields. In 1963 Mr. J.T.Newington,a business man from Spalding, whose hobby was boating, saw the old pit on the outskirts of Oundle. To set up the new facility a channel was cut through ten feet of bank to the River Nene and a roadway and carpark were built. The original buildings included a workshop, a chandlery, a boat showroom and winter storage facilities for boats. In May 1964 the Marina was opened, with river cruisers for hire and moorings to let to boat owners.
